content:
The chunk provides an explanation of texture coordinates (uv's) and their conventions, which is crucial for understanding how texture maps are applied to 3D models in texturing.

These texture coordinates are sometimes called uv's because of the (u, v) name of the coordinate pair. Almost any modeling package that you might use to create a model can create texture coordinates at the same time, and many do it without even asking.

By convention, every texture map is assigned a (u, v) coordinate range such that the u coordinate ranges from 0 to 1 from left to right, and the v coordinate ranges from 0 to 1 from bottom to top.
